subtitleNullable: Is it possible to predict the next earthquake?
descriptionNullable:
## Introduction
- This dataset houses the processed NEFS (Near Event Far Station) time-series waveform, collected via IRIS and GFZ data providers, with the aid of [ObsPy](https://docs.obspy.org/index.html) package.
- This dataset consists of data for all the NEFS seismic events that occurred between the duration **01/01/2000** to **31/12/2018**.
- The scripts used to download this data can be found in this [Github Repository](https://github.com/Elemento24/NTU-Seismology-Artificial-Intelligence).

## About NEFS
- In NEFS, the events are within the study region, and the stations are 25° to 95° away from the study site.

## Geospatial Coverage
- This dataset is primarily focused at collecting data of seismic events in South-East Asia.
- The area of coverage can be defined using the following 4 coordinates, as can be seen in the below image:
    - 16.00 N, 90.00 E (Bay of Bengal)
    - 30.00 N, 90.00 E (Nagqu, Tibet, China)
    - 16.00 N, 104.00 E (Roi Et, Thailand)
    - 30.00 N, 104.00 E (Sichuan, China)

[![rRVvpK.png](https://i.im.ge/2022/06/04/rRVvpK.png)](https://im.ge/i/rRVvpK)

## Other Datasets
Since the data is too large to accumulate in a single dataset, and Kaggle only allows up to **107 GB** in a single dataset, hence, I have created multiple datasets to host the entire dataset. You can find the other datasets as referenced below:
-  [Earthquakes Time-Series Analysis (NSFE | Part 1)](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/elemento/ntu-rw)
- [Earthquakes Time-Series Analysis (NSFE | Part 2)](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/elemento/earthquakes-timeseries-analysis-nsfe-part-2)
- [Earthquakes Time-Series Analysis (NSFE | Part 3)](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/elemento/earthquakes-timeseries-analysis-nsfe-part-3)
- [Earthquakes Time-Series Analysis (NEFS)](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/elemento/earthquakes-timeseries-analysis-nefs)
- [Earthquakes Time-Series Analysis (NSFE_SAC)](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/elemento/earthquakes-timeseries-analysis-nsfe-sac)
